name: Eliot Hotel

reviews.title: Fine Old Boston Hotel
reviews.text: Stayed at the Eliot for 1 night. (Convention in town) Not sure where the negative review came from, but we were very pleased with the Eliot. No, there was no view from the room but an alleyway, but hey! the hotel is on Commonwealth Ave in the city and was not designed for the view...Room was very clean, service was outstanding and everyone we encountered was extremely pleasant and unfailingly helpful. We would definitely stay again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Based on reviews here and their inclusion on the Conde Nast Traveller Gold List I was shocked by the Eliot Hotel. The staff is incompetent, fond of giving incorrect answers to questions and seem to be totally unsupervised. My wife and I checked into our room to discover a shower that fell apart when you turned the knob and outfitted with a shower head that would be unacceptable for a Motel 6. A door that seemed to house part of the heating system refused to stay closed although neither of us ever opened it which may or may not have also had something to do with the room's refusal to remain warm enough for a winter night. We were attending a wedding next door and upon returning at 10 past 12 were told that a limited room service menu was available. We ordered a turkey sandwich and after being told that it would take 45 minutes to an hour for the crack staff to put even that simple meal together settled in to wait for our meal. 15 minutes later we received a call telling us that there was no turkey sandwich left - these things happen but how in the world does it take a hotel that pretends to be high class and well appointed by professional staff that long to discover there isn't any turkey in the house. Especially when it's one of only three things you're allowed to order past the arbitrary midnight cutoff. The housekeeping staff pounds on the door at 6:15 Sunday night for turndown, we were on our way out shortly thereafter and asked them to return later. When we got home from the event we found an untouched room, par for the course for this mess of a hotel. Stay elsewhere in Boston, the Eliot is not worth your time nor your money.
reviews.title: Really Awful Hotel

likes.liked: — Next door to the event we were attending

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After reading the many reviews of where to stay in Boston, we settled on the Eliot Hotel and we are very happy we made that decision.
reviews.title: Top location, service and comfort
nice, warm and comfortable
reviews.text: The hotel is ideally located less than one block from the green line T in Back Bay. Newbury Street shops are an easy stroll and we easily walked to Boston Common, Beacon Hill, Downtown and even to the North End (we had good weather!). The bus to Harvard also stops right at the corner and cabs were easy hailed by the doormen.

Service is very efficient and friendly, from opening doors and helping with luggage to efficient check in and check out to room service requests for a refrigerator, extra glasses and ice to an accommodating business center.
reviews.title: Staff problems at the Eliot
great little hotel
reviews.text: The hotel restaurant Clio is seriously ambitious, and obviously very popular with Bostonians, extremely intense flavours, quite rich - and of course expensive!
We liked the Eliot, and would definitely stay again.
reviews.title: Great service, location, comfort

reviews.text: Very disappointing experience for a place that is supposed to be competing with the many great hotels in Boston. Upon arrival, I told the desk staff member I was checking in. She asked my name, which I gave her. She turned to her computer - I thought to start the checking process - and another guest walked up. She proceeded to check him in while I was still standing there waiting. Being ignored at the front desk was just one of a series of similar lapses that happened on numerous occasions - and I was only there 1 night! Room service was poor - no knife on the tray, long wait to get dinner, etc. The room decor was nice, although the bathroom in my suite was barely large enough for me to turn around in. The poorly trained and disorganized staff made it a very stressful stay. I would absolutely not stay here again.
reviews.title: Great for the business traveler

likes.disliked: — Mattress the tiniest bit firm for my taste

reviews.title: noisy, uncomfortable, horrible service
reviews.text: staff gave us incorrect directions to a venue and we were lost in the city and late for the wedding. we could hear everything going on in the rooms adjacent, so needless to say, we did not get any sleep. no one helped us with our bags. all in all, we paid premium rates for this less than average accomodation. definitely NOT a luxury hotel. if you want luxury, stick to the four seasons or the ritz-carlton. otherwise, the westin and the marriott copley square are much better places to stay. we will NEVER stay here again. better off staying at a days inn or motel 6!

The very continental Eliot Hotel in Boston is in a terrific location - walking distance to Newbury Street and to Fenway Park. Beautiful, ultra clean, spacious rooms and a friendly accomodating staff make your stay a wonderful experience.
reviews.title: Best Boutique Hotel in Boston

likes.disliked: — Some rooms do not have a view

reviews.text: A great location on Massachusetts and Commonwealth avenues for access to shops, restaurants, and areas to walk. It was a bit farther from the Public Gardens than we'd realized, but if we'd had enough time it still would have been easy walking distance. The restaurant located in the hotel, Clio, was excellent--definitely not the standard hotel restaurant fare--and we were glad we'd selected it from the various options in the neighborhood. The hotel and room felt like an elegant European hotel, though the room size was larger than most small European hotels. The staff was fantastic and we will definitely return there whenever their prices are competitive.
reviews.title: Wonderful small hotel

likes.liked: — Small, quiet hotel in good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This boutique hotel in the Back Bay section of Boston was a treat for my husband and me. We visit Boston often, because our son attends college there. The cost was very reasonable, and for less that what we usually pay for a tiny room at the nearby Hilton, we had a beautiful suite with complimentary cookies. The room was very clean. We will definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Wonderful, clean hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found most hotels to be expensive in the area that we wanted to stay, but got a reasonable rate at this hotel. This is a quaint hotel with lots of charm. The staff was attentive and friendly. Always quick to offer a "hello". The interior was clean and modern. Good location to access public transportation to tour the city. Only negative was the air conditioning which never seemed to cool the room.
reviews.title: Nice Experience

reviews.text: During our recent stay at the Eliot we specified a non-smoking room, which was provided, except that the air vent in the bathroom literally poured fresh cigarette smoke either from another part of the hotel or outside directly into our bathroom. Because we got in late and were tired we shut the door to the bathroom and went to sleep. When we woke up and brought the problem to the attention of the front desk (who visited the room to confirm the problem), they promised to provide us with another bathroom to shower and get ready for the rest of our trip in. They were unable to do this before we left, and said that because we booked through hotels.com they could not do anything else for us. All in all, for the price and four star rating, I was very unsatisfied with this hotel and their service/smoke problem. On the plus side, the location on Commonwealth Ave and near Newberry street and Fenway is excellent.
reviews.title: Smoke/Service Problem

likes.disliked: — smoke pouring into the room through the ventalation system/poor staff response

reviews.text: Our family of 4 spent 4 nights at the Eliot, and would certainly recommend the hotel. It is quite small, and thus far more personal than some of the other US hotels we have stayed in. The room was very nice, although the beds did seem a little short for my over 6 foot tall husband. It was not enormous, but this is Boston, and I am lead to believe that hotels here are small and expensive. We didn;' bother with room service or having breakfast delivered to the room as there are places locally which are a very easy walk. There was a great Bookstore on Newbury Street where we ate breakfast which was better value for money than the hotel. They did make a rather significant error on the bill, charging us for 2 rooms instead of 1, so do check this before you hand over your credit card. But the location is superb - very close to a Green line T station.
reviews.title: Superb location

reviews.text: Just returned from a 4 night stay at the Eliot and couldn't really fault it. We had a suite on the 9th floor which was tastefully decorated and very comfortable. We were offered turn-down service every night and the staff couldn't be more accomodating, from doorman to restaurant/bar staff. We didn't carry a single piece of luggage - there was always someone there to do it for us. I would highly recommend this hotel and would give it a 4.5 star rating if I could!
reviews.title: No problems

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I booked this hotel as a well priced centralish hotel, in a good area. The price was right, and service great, but we found the bed to be horrid, traffic noise loud (older windows), drafty, and the room bright as the window blinds didn't close all the way, after two nights we switched to a hotel that was more central with much more comfortable beds. The location was awesome, great walks down nice streets, and the neighbourhood felt very safe walking at night. Nice cafe's and resturants on nearby streets (less then a block away). Whatever you value make your choice, but ultimately comfort was ours.
reviews.title: Great Location, wished we could sleep...

likes.disliked: — Comfort of Bed, overall room comfort, traffic noise, feeling nickled and dimed.

reviews.text: I stayed there on business. They offer valet parking at $36 per day. While we were taking our bags out of the car (we hadn't even had a chance to check in) one of the valets brought another guest's car around to the entrance and backed directly into our car while parking. TWICE. Management was very confrontational about it, and had the attitude that we were making a big deal out of nothing.
reviews.title: Hardly a luxery hotel

reviews.text: My wife, son and I just spent two nights and were impressed by this hotel, which certainly deserves the great recognition and reviews it gets. The location is fine - my wife enjoyed being near Newbury and my son enjoyed being near Fenway Park - and why someone would want to stay at the Ritz-Carlton or Four Seasons rather than this well-appointed, intimate place with a great restaurant downstairs is beyond me. Our one complaint was with the parking - it's valet (of course) but the front desk didn't tell us (or any of the other guests who checked out the day we left) of the wait time for our car to be retrieved, which delayed our departure quite considerably. Be prepared for as much as an hour's wait!
reviews.title: Great Back Bay Choice

reviews.text: SUPERB in every way.....My husband and I had never been to Boston and we were absolutely thrilled with our choice of the Eliot Hotel. His business conference was next door at the Harvard Club, which was perfect. But the best part for me was the proximity I had to the entire city for 3 days while he had meetings. We stayed an additional 2 days to enjoy Boston on our own and LOVED the city and the Eliot Hotel! Our one bedroom KING suite was outstanding....we had 3 large windows, as our room was on the corner of Commonwealth/Mass Ave. and our suite was huge. We knew the bathroom was likely NOT going to be large, by others accounts-which was fine, but it was a gorgeous suite, lovely fabrics, very cozy/comfortable bed with lovely sheets/duvet/pillows, and the closet space was immense, as well as our foyer with wet bar. We ordered room service coffee each morning, which was wonderful, although a coffee maker in the room would be welcomed. We had the BEST service I believe we've ever experienced in a hotel....the staff knew who we were, along with the bellman, who hailed a cab for us several times....and the staff was always eager to please, but they were not annoying in the least....just the opposite. The e-mail contacts I had with various staff members was so helpful, prior to our arrival. Everyone went out of their way to make our stay special.....and we loved the entire experience. We were able to walk to Fenway for a RedSox game one night, hop the train one block away, walk to Newbury Street for shopping/coffee/meals whenever we liked, and we always felt safe too. What is not to like about this hotel!!! We strongly recommend booking a one bedroom suite, as we loved the additional space vs. a regular room. Other reviews mention the noise - but traffic is something you cannot prevent in a location like this, so you have to put up with that. We will always recommend this hotel to anyone we know traveling to Boston!
reviews.title: Cream of the Crop - The Eliot Hotel

likes.liked: — The suite was gorgeous, and the staff was also superb.
likes.disliked: — Wish the bathrooms were larger, but everything else made up for that.

reviews.title: Charming Boston Hotel
reviews.text: My husband, baby daughter and I stayed in the Eliot Hotel for one night after a weeklong trip to Cape Cod. We wanted to stay in Boston Saturday night to be close to the airport for our Sunday morning flight. We have stayed in several hotels in Boston over the years and we were thrilled with this hotel. We had a premier suite that was large and perfect for us. The living room was a perfect place to put our daughter in her

I reserved a room at The Eliot Hotel at the 11th hour and was really pleased that they could accomodate me. I only needed my room for a few hours in the morning as I was arriving straight off an overnight flight from LA. The staff checking me in at 6AM were really helpful and offered a free checkout extension which was great. They also booked me table at a great restaurant for my client lunch later that afternoon.
reviews.title: Red Eye Arrival

reviews.text: My suite was very comfortable and clean. The a/c was quite noisy as was the heating installation but I got used to the noise in the end.
reviews.title: Elated after my stay at the Eliot!

likes.disliked: — Having to pay for internet access, however, the rate was comparable if not cheaper than other hotels in the area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only issue with the suite was in the bathroom where there was a leak however as i was only staying for 4 hrs it didnt really matter.
reviews.title: Wonderful All-Around

likes.liked: — Comfortable and stylish, plus great location

reviews.text: The staff were really helpful except for the afternoon receptionist who was rude and agressive.
reviews.title: Early Hotel Charmed in Boston

likes.disliked: — Floors needed batter vacuuming in the room

reviews.text: From the moment I entered the Eliot Hotel the service,staff, and accomodations were excellent. My friends and I stayed in one of their guest rooms for a conference in Boston- after my experience I would definitely return again! This was a charming botique hotel.
reviews.title: YUCK - are you kidding me?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Eliot during Memorial Day weekend while we were getting married in Boston (at a different location). The staff could not have been more wonderful to us, helping us with many little details, and even getting collar stays for my husband just before the wedding. In fact, we left them with part of our wedding cake to say thanks!
reviews.title: Great Treatment at the Eliot

reviews.text: We've stayed at hotels all over Boston. None can beat the Eliot's location, right near Newbury Street and a block from the green line. And the rooms are absolutely charming.
reviews.title: Bad experience at the Elliot Hotel

reviews.text: I was surprised to read in a recent review that there was no one available to help with bags, etc. We never had that problem--Doormen were always on hand to assist. As for street noise, the Eliot is on a busy corner in Boston, but that's part of the great location. As for a $10 in-room internet charge, well, the hotel also offered free 24-hour internet access in its business center behind reception. The hotel also provided me with a free voucher to use a great sports club nearby.
reviews.title: Inconsistent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I heartily recommend the Eliot and we will stay there again and again when we visit Boston.
reviews.title: Well appointed, in good location, minor issue with noise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Last Friday, I booked a suite for my daughter and I at the Elliot. I drove about 31/2 hours from NY, to help her move from one section of Boston to another.
reviews.title: Fantastic Experience

reviews.text: This hotel is just excellent! Everything is perfect: service, rooms, restaurant, location! There are just no things I can think of which are not good... The staff is so friendly and helpful, amazing! The nice decor and size of the rooms are superb! This is absolut the number 1 hotel in Boston!
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, best in Boston!

reviews.text: Our family of five stayed in a one bedroom suite. The decor was beautiful, but it was small for the five of us. I understand that the corner suites are larger; I wish I had known to ask for one of those. The bathroom was quite tiny. There is only a low, three door chest to put clothes in. (There is plenty of room for a taller chest and I would recommend that they replace the short chests with taller ones.)
reviews.title: Lovely, but formal, hotel in a great location

reviews.text: I think that maybe the management has read the reviews about lack of a doorman, because EVERY time we came and went, we saw a doorman. The doormen were very helpful with luggage, etc.
reviews.title: A Place I Call Home Away From Home!
pleasant staff, uncomfortable accomodations
reviews.text: The hotel was a bit formal for us; the biggest pain was that there were no ice machines on the floors, so we had to request that ice be brought to the room. We are more used to being able to help ourselves.

reviews.title: an absolute gem!!
reviews.text: I asked that the mini-bar fridge be emptied so that we could use it for milk for the kids. They emptied the tiny fridge for us, but it turned out that it was barely cool, so it really wan't usable.

description: The Eliot Hotel is set on one of the most beautiful boulevards in America, a stone's throw from fashionable Newbury St. shopping, Copley Place and Boston’s major art galleries and cultural attractions, as well as universities and research centers. This historic, boutique hotel provides European luxury and unique elegance not found in other downtown Boston area hotels.
